name: New Wine For Old Wineskins Online Quiz | Vocabulary | 10 Questions

questions.text:
The answer to every question will be one word and include the letters red in that order. In most cases, red will not be the first three letters of the correct word.  

As a wine connoisseur, your wine shopping experience includes label comparisons, conversation with other shoppers, and maybe even a taste test if you're so lucky. When you finally reach your decision, the question at the cash register is easy: "Will you be paying by cash or_______?"
questions.explanation:
credit.

	The idea for the first credit card was derived from a 1949 dinner in New York City. Frank X. McNamara met with fellow businessmen to discuss a situation regarding a client, who had borrowed some money but was unable to repay it. At the end of the meal, McNamara reached for his wallet only to realize he had forgotten it. He brought these two concepts together to release the first credit card.

questions.text:
You've invited some friends over for dinner to discuss the latest wine that you've discovered. One red wine has piqued your interest, and you pass it around for your friends to have a taste. 

What six letter word, that contains the word red, explains what you did with the wine? The answer is a past tense of a word meaning to give out portions to others.
questions.explanation:
shared.

	In the world of fiction, such as the story in this quiz, a shared universe exists as the same setting for multiple works. Some examples include J.R.R. Tolkien's which was used for "The Hobbit" and "The Lord of the Rings", and the DC Comics universe. Shared, with a different pronounciation, is also a village in northern Iran.

questions.text:
This new wine you've discovered has become quite the little sensation among your friends so you run back to buy some more. To your relief, you quickly find the product on the shelves, and it's on sale too!

What is a nine letter word, that contains the word "red", that is a synonym of sale, or discount?
questions.explanation:
reduction.

	Reduction has many definitions in various academic fields. In chemistry, reduction reactions are reactions where the atoms involved reduce, or lower, their oxidation states. Reductionism is also a major philosophical view that contends that an object can be taken apart to reveal that it is simply the sum of the parts that make it up.

questions.text:
With nothing to do on a lazy Friday night, you decide a treat yourself with some wine and a good movie. 

Enter a seven letter word which contains the word "red", and means "the state of having no interest at a given time".
questions.explanation:
boredom.

	Boredom might be an excuse for why you're taking this quiz! The French word for boredom, ennui, is sometimes used in the English language under the same definition.

questions.text:
Browsing through the channels, you settle on a movie from 1987 that stars Arnold Schwarzenegger as a US Army soldier tasked with saving important politicians from Guatemala, but later runs into a brutal monster in his path.

The name of that movie is the same as an eight letter word that contains the word red, which is defined any animal that preys on other animals. What is the word?
questions.explanation:
Predator.

	"Predator" was directed by John McTiernan and Carl Weathers, Jesse Ventura and Elpidia Carrillo all starred alongside Schwarzenegger. The idea for the movie came up from a joke made after the release of "Rocky IV" that suggested an alien monster was the only thing left for Rocky Balboa to fight. The movie was a hit in the theatres when released, grossing the second highest profit for the year of film.

questions.text:
This new wine has got you so interested that you decide to write a nice review of it on your blog. You pen a very elaborate critique looking at the versatility and taste of the wine but in the end mistakenly omit the hue of the wine.

If you want to say the wine has a specific hue, you could use this seven or eight letter word that contains the word "red". (UK and US English spelling accepted)
questions.explanation:
colored & coloured.

	Color, the American English spelling, was one of many words slightly altered in a way to separate the new United States from the United Kingdom in the late 18th century. Other words that were changed to differentiate the US from the UK include honour -> honor, theatre -> theater, and defense -> defence. In the United States, the word colored has racial connotations relating to the US Civil Rights Movement of the 1960s. While the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People uses colored in their title, other advocates have protested that colored is also a derogatory term.

questions.text:
In your review, you finish with a fairly bold statement, proclaiming that your new favourite wine will become a favourite among others too and become a big seller before too long.

What word could be substituted above, a verb that means attempting to foresee a future result or event, and also contains the word "red"?
questions.explanation:
predict.

	We've all made predictions, both good and bad, but luckily they don't often become front page news. New York Jets quarterback Joe Namath correctly predicted he'd lead his team to a win in the Super Bowl. On the flip side however, Decca Records told Brian Epstein in 1962 that his client, The Beatles, had no future in show business.

questions.text:
Your clout in the wine community has led to many others to try this new sensation you've uncovered, clearly turned on by such a positive review. This added business bumps the sales drastically, and surprise, surprise, this wine is now a bestseller! You were absolutely correct!

Enter a nine letter word here that contains the word "red", and that could be used in a phrase to describe what you did on your guarantee, as well as describing the act of having given the proper recipient a package or letter.
questions.explanation:
delivered.

	Mail, pizzas and newspapers can all be delivered to your home or office. Metaphorically, when you do something you had promised to do, you are said to have delivered the goods.

questions.text:
With your positive review that led to many sales, the winemakers have presented you with eight and a third dozen bottles of wine! What a fine and unexpected reward! 

What is a seven letter word that is a much easier way of saying eight and a third dozens and includes the word "red"?
questions.explanation:
hundred.

	One hundred is represented by the letter C in Roman numerals, and 100°C is the boiling point of pure water at sea level. 100 also has significance in the sports world - it is the record for most points scored by a player in an NBA game (Wilt Chamberlain in 1950), the length in yards of an American football field, and the amount of runs required for a century in cricket.

questions.text:
Out on the town one night, you've indulged in perhaps one too many glasses of wine, so you decide that public transit or a taxi would be the best way to go home. 

This word is an eight-lettered word that contains the word "red" and describes your situation, and is often used to describe alcohol's impact on the judgment of drunk drivers.
questions.explanation:
impaired.

	Impaired can also refer to those with any handicap, both physically or mentally. Impaired driving is the formal term for driving with some form of obstruction to optimal performance, whether it being over the legal limit of alcohol, having drugs in your body, or sleep deprivation.
